Review Title: Great career growth opportunities, but you need to be lucky to have a good manager
Pros:
Amdocs is a big international company, you will face professional challenges thanks to that that will sharpen your skills and experience.
The company also invest a lot in employee experience and in changing the image of it in the tech industry, unlimited vacation is one example.
Cons:
You need to be lucky to have a good manager.. managerial style is not a value in focus in the company hence your work climate can vary dramatically per unit.
Because of that 
- many managers manage up - look up to their "bonus provider" and less on the benefit of their managed teams.
- you may see old style managers, being rude and aggressive to their people as if we didn't learn anything since the 90's ...
I used to think this is a result of the company size, but now I know its a matter of values in focus.
Promotions are not always available, no matter how appreciated you are.

Review Title: Boon for some and Pain for many
Pros:
With my insanely short exp with Amdocs I have seen a lot. 
from darkest to the brightest. I would not elongate this post with fancy words 
1. Amdocs offers free breakfast ( fruits and heavy breakfasts/ evening snacks) But you can only enjoy these if your managment is composed, otherwise you get free pressure with all of these.
So bad that, at times I could see people enjoy everything, while we were having meetings/ useless sessions etc. 

2. Amdocs offers discounted quality food
3. Great work places ( especially tower 2)
4. Invests in future tech
Cons:
High work pressure
Bad management
Some employees were layed off
Even one of my team mates was put on PIP and then he was layed off
1. Fake promises of Onsite
2. Pressure, very high pressure with deliverables
3. Those who work, get more work

Review Title: A decent one with good opportunities
Pros:
High-end tech and architectural solutions, detailed documentation. Huge scope of techs are involved into products. The place go-to learn best practices. The people I've succeeded to work with all of great pesonality and professional skills. In my case, greater managerial policy - supportive and encourage. 
Being the enterprise implies perks like, payed courses, LinkedIn subscription, social activity to facilitate professional grows within the company. 
Company recently moved to the new offices - facilities and services without the rival.
Cons:
It sounds questionable the policy to invest into vigorous social and promotional activity to find out at very soon a need for stuff reduction. In my case I haven't effective opportunity to get a position in another department. I'd be the worst one to advice here, but it was pretty much of despondency to leave the office that glares with posters "Amdocs family". I didn't feel like there was the effort of HR to solve the issue and do the best keeping me company's employee. 
Another thing to mention - the company employed an open-space solution for the office. There are both supporters and opponents of the approach - I'd say it depends, but my personal preference would be an ability of choice.

Pros: Cutting edge technologies, Work-life balance, good salaries and benefits, great HR treatment
Cons: sometimes there is lot of work load

Pros: A great place to work for, large company.
Cons: Might require to work from office daikly.

Review Title: Good place to work in some circumstances
Pros: - Good vacation policy - Good only for freshers as alot is invested in early stage learning but 3 years is deadline for your learning here. - Good return policy to Amdocs which serves as a hack to increase your pay by switching, and comeback and do the same work you are doing but with better pay. - Free food and various similar perks are great.
Cons: - Management performed Layoffs like a Ninja. People were silently let go in market down time using PIP and then asked to self resign. The company environment in 2023 early layoffs was scary. - Once layoff was done, started hiring freshers with 10-13LPA while people with even 3-4 years experience were making less than them and mentoring these expensive freshers. - Management always shows everything is spotless and then suddenly starts breaking bombs like “No one in company will get any hike” - happened for FY 2023

Pros: Work life balance and great culture

Review Title: Great benefits, always lots of work
Pros:
Amdocs has great benefits, good compensation and rewards. 
Always lots of work to be done, but this depends on the team you are on and position you are in.
Cons:
Work life balance is non-existent.
They do offer unlimited vacation but due to the amount of work, it’s easier not take vacation, when you have to find your own coverage. 
Team morale and company culture needs improvement.
Lots of people are in different locations and timezones so it can make work a bit more stressful at times.

Review Title: A great place to develop personally and also make a difference
Pros: Amdocs is a very big company which has lots of different organizations, and a big variety of customers. Along the years you can move from one are of expertise to another, from one kind of a customer to a completely different one, from managerial roles to non-managerial and back. The opportunities are almost endless. And it's all very international, so you get to work with lots of people from many different countries. It opens your mind and provides you with great skills in many areas.
Cons: There's no real job security in Hi-Tech, and Amdocs is part of it. Not everything is within your cycle of control, and along the years there could be more difficult times or moments. Not all the customers are nice to work with.

Review Title: good opportunity to learn and grow
Pros:
Amdocs have different projects each project have it is own structure,
the project that I work at is kind of startup company in Amdocs, this give us the chance to learn, to lead, and to make a change.
Cons:
work life balance is not the best, almost each month we have a week where we need to work more to achieve a new goal. 
they give the employee more and more work and responsibility without a raise in the salary or a good bonus (one bonus per year and it is not sufficient)
